result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Justin A. Blaha was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Defendant's counsel was court-appointed, Defendant to repay Richland County the costs of this counsel.  Once counsel's bill has been submitted to Richland County, Richland County will pay it.  The Defendant will then have 30 days to repay Richland County.  Failure to pay court-appointed counsel fees may result in the clerk's use of civil judgment, tax refund interception, and State Debt Collection (SDC) Agency to collect this debt.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court with Defendant Justin A. Blaha, in person. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionairre/waiver of rights given to the court by Atty Longacre.  Atty Longacre states they are ready to go forward with plea/sentencing, with guidelines dropping down 1 level on the charge of OWI (3rd) and charges #2 and #3 are being dismissed.
Def pleas NC to the charge of OWI (3rd).  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Court finds factual basis of charge.  Finding of Guilty.  Court directs clerk to enter JOC.

Sentence:  $600 + cost, 45 days jail, 24 mo rev., IID order for 24 months, 2 days credit; AODA; huber granted; 60 dtp
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court notes this is on the calendar for plea/sentencing today; has been set that way several times; asks if parties are ready to move forth.  Atty. L notes medical issue with def's family member and reluctantly asks for rescheduling.  Forehand states she's okay with reset if it's a short setover. Def asks for March 1st.  Court sets 3/1 at 11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.

1:45 p.m.  Defendant Justin A. Blaha not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Justin A. Blaha.  This matter was set for 1:30 p.m.  ADA Forehand informs the Court that, earlier today, Atty. Longacre called after receiving call from his client indicating client had vehicle problems.  Forehand takes no position on warrant issuance.  Court resets this matter for 2/1 at 9; if Def doesn't appear then, there will be a warrant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Atty. Longacre makes verbal request to reschedule the plea/sentencing for a few weeks due to def injury/medical emergency.  No objection from the DA.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.
11/4 plea/sentencing reset due to Court emergency.  Clerk has confirmed reset date of 12/2 at 11 with Def and Atty. Longacre.
Atty. Longacre's request to move plea/sentencing from 10/24 to 10/28 or 11/4
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Atty. Longacre's request to adj. the plea/sentencing from 9/26 until after 10/7; no objection from ADA Forehand; clerk resets to 10/24 at 1:30
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State has filed amended criminal complaint - count 1 is now OWI 3rd; count 3 is now PAC 3rd; count 2 remains as misdemeanor bail jumping.  Formal reading waived.  Def pleads no contest to count 1/OWI 3rd.  Court's colloquy on plea.  During plea colloquy, Def states he wants to know about ankle bracelet possibility before he goes to disposition in this matter; would like adjournment of this matter until he's had a chance to find out.  Court adjourns sentencing to 9/26 at 3:30 and then completes the plea colloquy, WITHHOLDING, on this date, a finding of guilt.
Status conference on September 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA has filed amended complaint; since filing of this case, Def was convicted of OWI 2nd in Vernon County, making the charge in this case OWI 3rd.  Atty. L alleges Shribner error with amended complaint - amended complaint still indicates OWI 2nd.  Matter adj. to 9/14 at 3:30.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's authorization for attorney to appear and act
Status conference on August 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Further status requested and set - possible plea/sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. L asks for additional status; negotiations in progress.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference at 03-16-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives formal reading of the complaint and is informed of the charges/max possible penalties. NG pleas entered. Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance at 02-19-2016 02:30 pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-19-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Justin A. Blaha in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def states he has receives the complaint; waives formal reading.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max penalties as well as his rights.  Def states that he does not qualify for SPD; asks for court-appointed counsel.  Court questions def to determine eligibility.  Court appoints Atty. Adrian Longacre and directs def to pay $100/mo to Clerk of Court for attorney fee escrow; first payment due 3/1 and on the 1st every month after.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
